sourceDesc.p: This is a born-digital edition created through custom XSLT from a OmniOutliner 3 XML file on 3 March 2014.

refsDecl.p: Bibliographic notes are marked with the ref element. This element carries the attribute type identifying the source of the reference – usually a reference managing software. ref type="SenteCitationID" identifies Sente as the reference manager. The target attribute contains the placeholder tag used by the software identified in type to refer to an individual reference or a group of references.

revisionDesc.tei:change: Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/bibliography_OpenArabicPE-periodicals.TEIP5.xml) and to OCLC (WorldCat) IDs to titless without such references based on biblStructs mentioned in the authority file (bibliography).

Added references to local authority file (/BachUni/BachBibliothek/GitHub/OpenArabicPE/authority-files/data/tei/gazetteer_OpenArabicPE.TEIP5.xml) and to GeoNames IDs to placeNames without such references based on places mentioned in the authority file.
revisionDesc.change: added data from Project Jarāʾid and other sources
All ref type="SenteCitationID" have been automatically formatted using information from the library of primary sources.
Added numerous rows based on readings during the last two years.
Changed all note with type ='SenteCitationID' to ref elements
corrected the faulty attribute values of corresp on note elements: the internal spaces in Sente IDs were replaced with "+" and the separating ";" has been replaced with whitespaces
Created by automatic conversion from OmniOutliner

we received the first issue of the newspaper Mirāʾat al-Sharq published in Egypt by Salīm Efendi ʿAnḥūrī . the director of publication is Amīn Efendi Nāṣīf

event.note: Muḥammad Shākir, graduate of the Mekteb-i Mülkiye, and Fāris Khūri, graduate of the AUB, obtained the permit to publish a daily newspaper under the title of al-Band in Damascus
Daily in Damascus by Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī

event.label: CP
event.note: ceased publication soon after Young Turk Revolution

event.label: P
event.note: Thrice a week.
New weekly published in Beirut by Jirjī Efendi Shāḥin ʿAṭiyya

event.label: P
event.note: The permit to publish a newspaper was sent to Ṣāliḥ Efendi, municipal doctor and member of the medical association in Damascus
Daily, published by ʿAbd al-Ghannī al-ʿUraysī in Beirut

event.note: educational journal

event.label: P
event.note: ʿAbdullah Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press ( al-Ḥikma ) and to publish two newspapers, al-Ḥikma and al-Rafīq , in his hometown

event.label: P
event.note: ʿAbdullah Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press ( al-Ḥikma ) and to publish two newspapers, al-Ḥikma and al-Rafīq , in his hometown

event.label: P

event.label: P

event.label: P

The editor arrived in Damascus
New daily
a new weekly newspaper published in Jidda by the concessionary Rāghib Efendi Muṣṭafā Tawkal . The editor is Adīb Efendi Dāwud Harārī . the first issue arrived in Damascus

event.note: The newspaper Nahḍa al-ʿArab from Paris is banned from import. Yet, newspapers continue to quote from this paper.

event.label: BI

event.label: P

div.head: Legend
div.p: The table is based on the table of suspensions, bans, and warnings provided by Cioeta, "Ottoman Censorship," 1979:182-185, which covered the years 1878-1908. I augmented his data with my readings, checked for corresponding gaps in publication when possible, corrected the dating, and added information on the years 1908-1914.
div.note: 1Dates provide the date of the warning, if known. Otherwise they represent the date of publication for the periodical they were printed in. The dates are always different from Cioeta's as he confused the Ottoman fiscal ( mālī ) or Julian calendars for Gregorian reckoning.

2BI: Ban on import; CS: Ceased publication; P: Permit or first publication; PR: Permit to resume publication; PI: Permit for import; RP: Resumed publication; S: Suspension ( taʿṭīl ); W: Warning ( ikhṭar ); 1: First issue published.
5Sources abbreviated as "TF" ( Thamarāt al-Funūn ) and "Iq" ( al-Iqbāl ) were solely provided by Cioeta

6Cioeta sometimes chose to present the officially designated period of suspension, while on other occasions, he presented the actual period of suspension. Here, I generally opted for the officially decreed period of suspension.
